## SelectCommonProps interface

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
export interface SelectCommonProps<T> 
```
<b>Import</b>

```typescript
import { SelectCommonProps } from '@grafana/ui';
```

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |

|  [loadingMessage](#loadingmessage-property) | <code>string</code> | Message to display isLoading=true |

|  [renderControl](#rendercontrol-property) | <code>ControlComponent&lt;T&gt;</code> | Use a custom element to control Select. A proper ref to the renderControl is needed if 'portal' isn't set to null |
|  [showAllSelectedWhenOpen](#showallselectedwhenopen-property) | <code>boolean</code> |  |
|  [tabSelectsValue](#tabselectsvalue-property) | <code>boolean</code> |  |
|  [value](#value-property) | <code>SelectValue&lt;T&gt; &#124; null</code> |  |
|  [width](#width-property) | <code>number &#124; 'auto'</code> | Sets the width to a multiple of 8px. Should only be used with inline forms. Setting width of the container is preferred in other cases. |

### "aria-label" property

Aria label applied to the input field

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
['aria-label']?: string;
```

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
allowCreateWhileLoading?: boolean;
```

```typescript
allowCustomValue?: boolean;
```

```typescript
autoFocus?: boolean;
```

```typescript
components?: any;
```

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
filterOption?: (option: SelectableValue<T>, searchQuery: string) => boolean;
```

### formatCreateLabel property

Function for formatting the text that is displayed when creating a new value

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
formatCreateLabel?: (input: string) => string;
```

### formatOptionLabel property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
formatOptionLabel?: (item: SelectableValue<T>, formatOptionMeta: FormatOptionLabelMeta<T>) => React.ReactNode;
```

### getOptionLabel property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
getOptionLabel?: (item: SelectableValue<T>) => React.ReactNode;
```

### getOptionValue property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
getOptionValue?: (item: SelectableValue<T>) => string;
```

### id property

The id to set on the SelectContainer component. To set the id for a label (with htmlFor),

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
id?: string;
```

### inputId property

The id of the search input. Use this to set a matching label with htmlFor

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
inputId?: string;
```

### inputValue property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
inputValue?: string;
```

```typescript
isOpen?: boolean;
```

### isOptionDisabled property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
isOptionDisabled?: () => boolean;
```

### isSearchable property

Disables the possibility to type into the input

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
isSearchable?: boolean;
```

### isValidNewOption property

allowCustomValue must be enabled. Determines whether the "create new" option should be displayed based on the current input value, select value and options array.

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
isValidNewOption?: (inputValue: string, value: SelectableValue<T> | null, options: OptionsOrGroups<unknown, GroupBase<unknown>>) => boolean;
```

### loadingMessage property

Message to display isLoading=true

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
loadingMessage?: string;
```

### maxMenuHeight property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
maxMenuHeight?: number;
```

### maxVisibleValues property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
maxVisibleValues?: number;
```

### menuPlacement property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
menuPlacement?: 'auto' | 'bottom' | 'top';
```

### menuPosition property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
menuPosition?: 'fixed' | 'absolute';
```

### menuShouldPortal property

Setting to true will portal the menu to `document.body`<!-- -->. This property will soon default to true and portalling will be the default behavior.

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
menuShouldPortal?: boolean;
```

### minMenuHeight property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
minMenuHeight?: number;
```

### noOptionsMessage property

The message to display when no options could be found

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
noOptionsMessage?: string;
```

### onBlur property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
onBlur?: () => void;
```

### onChange property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
onChange: (value: SelectableValue<T>, actionMeta: ActionMeta) => {} | void;
```

### onCloseMenu property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
onCloseMenu?: () => void;
```

### onCreateOption property

allowCustomValue must be enabled. Function decides what to do with that custom value.

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
onCreateOption?: (value: string) => void;
```

### onInputChange property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
onInputChange?: (value: string, actionMeta: InputActionMeta) => void;
```

```typescript
onKeyDown?: (event: React.KeyboardEvent) => void;
```

```typescript
openMenuOnFocus?: boolean;
```

```typescript
options?: Array<SelectableValue<T>>;
```

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
placeholder?: string;
```

### prefix property

item to be rendered in front of the input

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
prefix?: JSX.Element | string | null;
```

### renderControl property

Use a custom element to control Select. A proper ref to the renderControl is needed if 'portal' isn't set to null

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
renderControl?: ControlComponent<T>;
```

### showAllSelectedWhenOpen property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
showAllSelectedWhenOpen?: boolean;
```

### tabSelectsValue property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
tabSelectsValue?: boolean;
```

### value property

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
value?: SelectValue<T> | null;
```

### width property

Sets the width to a multiple of 8px. Should only be used with inline forms. Setting width of the container is preferred in other cases.

<b>Signature</b>

```typescript
width?: number | 'auto';
```
